name: Wistful  and  Nostalgic Quiz | TV & Movies Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Thomas Wolfe wrote "You Can't Go Home Again". Why was that true of the protagonist in that novel?
questions.correct: He had written about his hometown and its residents
options: He had been suspected of being involved in a crime
He had been involved in a romantic scandal
He had had a drinking problem
questions.explanation:
He had written about his hometown and its residents.

	Wolfe's protagonist, George Webber, burned his bridges (so to speak) when he wrote his book.

questions.text: Who had a hit with a song that observed that "you don't know what you've got till it's gone"?
questions.explanation:
Joni Mitchell.

	"Big Yellow Taxi". "Don't it always seem to go that you don't know what you've got till it's gone". How very, very true.

questions.text: What poet longed to "sleep as I in childhood sweetly slept"?
questions.explanation:
John Clare.

	The poem is usually entitled "I Am". For all his talent - he's often referred to as an English Burns - Clare lived a life of poverty and hardship, culminating in institutionalization.

questions.text: In an episode of "The Twilight Zone", this fellow wanders back to his childhood home - and encounters himself as a young boy.
questions.explanation:
Gig Young.

	All four of these starred in episodes of the "Twilight Zone", but Gig Young is the person who journeys back.

questions.text: Who said that "youth is wasted on the young"?
questions.explanation:
George Bernard Shaw.

	If anyone ever wants to know how to be profound and obvious at the same time, refer him (or her) to this quote. Simple, yet brilliant.

questions.text: Who said that "youth is the only thing worth having"?
questions.explanation:
Oscar Wilde.

	Perhaps a bit of an over-statement ... but Wilde was definitely on the right track. (See preceding question and comment.)

questions.text: What poet wrote about "the tender grace of a day that is dead"?
questions.explanation:
Alfred, Lord Tennyson.

	"Break, Break, Break". "The tender grace of a day that is dead will never come back to me".

questions.text: Roy Clark had a huge hit with "Yesterday When I Was Young". Who was the composer?
questions.explanation:
Charles Aznavour.

	Magnificent song, superbly done by Clark. Great lyrics.

questions.text: In "Taxi", Harry Chapin reminisces when he encounters an old girl friend from the past. Things hadn't quite worked out for either of them. What were his and her dreams in the old days?
questions.explanation:
Pilot, Actress.

	"She was gonna be an actress - and I was gonna learn to fly ..."Well-done by Chapin. Interesting song to listen to.

questions.text: What poet wistfully reflected on his youth in "I Remember, I Remember"?
questions.explanation:
Thomas Hood.

	"I remember, I remember the house where I was born/the little window where the sun came peeking in at dawn/it never came a bit too soon nor brought too long a day/but now I often wish the night would steal my breath away".
